primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God overcomes the human inability to believe in unconditional love by demonstrating His infinite capacity and willingness to help.

tekstueel_bewijs: God can help us without lessening his own resources
God gave his Son our souls to save

object.identificatie: The Human Soul / The Hearer (Salvation and Sustenance)
tekstueel_bewijs: uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness
But because the Lord loved you
designated them as his own special people
help you, my brother and my sister

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Holy Spirit (implied in 'holy blood')
tekstueel_bewijs: I have Jesus Christ as proof that God is willing
He that spared not his own Son
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject and Helper (via Christ)

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Logic / The 'Fair Exchange' Theory / Doubt
tekstueel_bewijs: our souls, which are doubting God's promise
everything can be grasped by the mind
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The primary obstacle is not sin as a cosmic power, but the human inability to intellectually process 'unmerited' grace.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to find a logical basis for faith.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Preacher
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (human logic) fails, forcing a transition to the primary program (God's action).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will help and God will heal.
God owns the cattle on a thousand hills.
The Lord did not set his love upon you... because ye were more.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We sense that we are not worthy.

voorbeelden: heaven knows it must be accepted on faith
show why it is reasonable to believe.
God can help us without lessening his own resources.
God is well able to help.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) to fulfill His 'Will' (Vouloir), bypassing the human 'Must' (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Fair Exchange), moves to ~S2 (Unworthiness), acknowledges ~S1 (Mystery), and resolves in S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the character of God (His infinite resources) rather than human logic.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a natural human instinct that must be 'staggered' by the Gospel.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor (Subject) of almost all salvific verbs. The human role is reduced to the 'Receiver' who is 'staggered' by unmerited favor.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Did Dr. King... overestimate our determination to reach fulfillment?

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as sole Subject of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God gave his Son our souls to save.
If we merited God's love, we could readily understand it.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Moses is used not as a model to follow, but as a witness to the mystery of God's choice.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them theocentrically.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; shifting from anxiety about performance to security in God's power.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; God's power is the sufficient cause of the believer's standing.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'fair exchange' logic to the 'infinite resource' logic of God is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'reasonableness' and 'mystery' is left somewhat unresolved, which is theologically appropriate.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on the Father and Son; the Spirit's role in applying grace is implicit but not named.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is seen as 'unworthiness' and 'faults' rather than total depravity or cosmic death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's 'Pouvoir' (Power). The human subject is correctly positioned as the beneficiary (Receiver).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more Devoir (Response) could be added at the very end to show the 'Secondary Program' of ethics.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Briefly mention how being 'upholden' by God enables the hearer to uphold others.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Frame the 'fair exchange' not just as a logical error, but as a prideful refusal to be a beggar before God.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Deepens the need for grace by showing that our logic is a form of self-righteousness.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. The preacher successfully resists the urge to give the audience 'three things to do,' focusing instead on the 'one thing God has done.'

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'grass cutting' anecdote as a tool for engagement; Greimas shows it functions as a foil to the divine actantial structure.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical context of Isaiah 41; Greimas focuses on the functional roles of 'The Upholder' and 'The Upholden'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch' where human logic (Subject 1) is defeated by Divine Power (Subject 2).

volledige_subject_lijst: God (strengthens, helps, upholds, loves, chooses, gives, heals)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Fair Exchange' anecdote as a semiotic S2 (Contrary) to highlight the radical nature of S1 (Grace).
